Package utilities

Class ImageManager

java.lang.Object
utilities.ImageManager
public class ImageManager extends Object
This basically reads the image assets from the assets/imageAssets folder so they can be included in the jar.

Partially based on sample code provided by Dr. Dimitri Ognibene as part of the CE218 Computer Games Programming module I took last year.

Author:
Rachel Lowe

  • Method Details

    • loadImage

      public static Image loadImage​(String fname) throws IOException
      Loads an image from a given file and also puts it on the map
      Parameters:
      fname - the name of the image file
      Returns:
      that image
      Throws:
      IOException - if something goes wrong.

    • loadBufferedImage

      public static BufferedImage loadBufferedImage​(String fname) throws IOException
      Basically it gets the image from the filename as a BufferedImage. easier than using loadImage to just cast the Image back to a BufferedImage, y'know?
      Parameters:
      fname - filename of the image to load
      Returns:
      that image as a bufferedImage
      Throws:
      IOException - if something goes wrong.
